author: Staff Reporter
text:
High drama marked the shifting of a nine-year old, who was rescued on Sunday to Chittoor town, with relatives of the girl’s adoptive mother attacking the rescue team of the Rural Organization for Poverty Eradication Services (ROPES) Childline. Police later intervened to ensure safe passage for the child and the aid workers.

The police raided the residence of a government teacher, Jayamma, in Madanapalle on Sunday following complaints that the woman had been ill-treating her adopted daughter for the last five years. The police handed the girl over to ROPES, authorising it to produce her before the Child Welfare Committee.
title: Amid drama, rescued child moved to Chittoor
